Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose family members on permanent residence application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in finding Nguyen was not a member of the family class under s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Yen failed to disclose Nguyen and two other children on her permanent residence application
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Nguyen ineligible for family class sponsorship
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Omission due to personal fears, not fraud
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Non-accompanying family members not examined during sponsor's application are excluded from family class
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Disclosure failure during initial application process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Error in IAD's interpretation of family class membership
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Permanent residence application form, non-disclosure of children
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged IAD's refusal to recognize Nguyen as family class member
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Section 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Outcome: Nguyen remains ineligible for family class sponsorship
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Recognition as family class member for sponsorship
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Exclusion under family class due to non-disclosure
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Eligible to apply under s. 25 for humanitarian and compassionate grounds

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Family class membership and inadmissibility based on non-disclosure
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: s. 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Outcome: Child ineligible for family class sponsorship
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Error in IAD’s determination that child was not family class member
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Disclosure of all family members during sponsorship application
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Refusal of sponsorship application by IRCC, affirmed by IAD
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations (not applicable at this stage)
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Child of sponsor seeking family class recognition
Crimes.Temporal_Context: At time of sponsor’s permanent residence application
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Exclusion from family class due to non-disclosure
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Regulatory compliance with family class definitions
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Family separation due to immigration rules
Crimes.Credibility: No credibility issue raised; omission attributed to fear
Crimes.Enforcement_Action: Application refusal based on regulatory exclusion
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Failure to disclose family member during application
